meanings.definition: To cause (a muscle) to undergo tetanus, or to contract continuously.
meanings.sent1: The electric shock made the muscle tetanize and stay stiff.
meanings.sent2: The doctor used a special technique to tetanize the muscle for examination.
meanings.sent3: The muscle decided to tetanize at the most inconvenient time during the race.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of heights seemed to tetanize her legs, making it impossible to move.
meanings.sent5: The image of the snake ready to strike was enough to tetanize him with fear.

meanings.definition: To induce or cause tetanus in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The contaminated wound could tetanize the entire body if left untreated.
meanings.sent2: The vaccine helps prevent the bacteria from tetanizing the body.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to tetanize the neighborhood cats by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest seemed to tetanize all the animals with fear.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead seemed to tetanize the atmosphere with tension.
